author: Megan Backhouse
title: Gardening events around town
text:
Astolat's garden in Camberwell will be open to view. Photo: supplied 
Spring festivals
Tours of the garden of St Erth (189 Simmons Reef Rd, Blackwood) will be held today and tomorrow as part of the garden's Spring Festival. There will be workshops on soil preparation (10.30am today and tomorrow), bee-keeping (12.30pm both days) and seed sowing (2.30pm both days) as well as other activities. The festival runs 9am to 5pm, $10 and free to Diggers Club members. Go to diggers.com.au for more information.
Also celebrating spring is 3000acres, the initiative that transforms vacant land into community growing spaces. The outfit's Saxon St Community Garden (33 Saxon Street, Brunswick) will host gardening workshops, a "vintage wares" market and food stalls from 12pm to 4pm today (Saturday October 10).
St Erth Spring Festival. Photo: supplied 
And the City of Stonnington is also putting on a "Spring Into Gardening" festival tomorrow (Sunday October 11) at Victoria Gardens (High Street, Prahran), 11am to 3pm. It will feature workshops, demonstrations (including on how to garden on roofs, walls and small or concrete spaces) and market stalls. Go to stonnington.vic.gov.au/springintogardening for more information.
Advertisement Garden openings
A large garden in Camberwell established around an 1880s Italianate mansion is open this weekend. The owners have spent 20 years restoring the garden that includes a fernery, cherry walk, perennial borders and mature trees such as an  Araucaria bidwillii​  and Agathis robusta​ . The garden at Astolat, 630 Riversdale Road, Camberwell, is open from 10am to 4.30pm today and tomorrow, and horticulturist and landscape designer Christine Schmols​ will give garden talks at 11am, 12.30pm and 2.30pm both days.  Entry is $10/under-18 free/students $5. Go to opengardensvictoria.org.au for more information.
Also open today is a productive garden in Heidelberg that is based around permaculture principles and has an aquaponics system in the front. The garden, at 4 Adamson Street, Heidelberg, is open today 11am to 3pm, $8. Go to sgaonline.org.au for more information.
Talk
Environmental scientist, landscape designer and Gardening Australia  presenter Josh Byrne will give this year's Josine McEwan Memorial Lecture as a fundraiser for Castlemaine's Buda home and garden next Saturday night (October 17). "Rethinking our suburbs, growing our communities" will be the subject of the talk that will be accompanied by dinner. Bookings are essential.  budacastlemaine.org.
